subject: Sales
title: Using Humor Without Risk
description: A micro-lesson that makes Using Humor Without Risk usable.

hook.text: A perfectly timed joke in a pitch can seal a deal. A poorly timed one can destroy it completely.

buildup.text: Humor builds rapport and lowers defenses. Laughter releases endorphins that prime positive decisions.

discovery.text: Self-deprecating humor works best in business. It signals confidence without threatening anyone.

twist.text: Never joke about the audience, competitors, or sensitive topics. No laugh is worth that kind of risk.

climax.text: Open with light, relatable humor. It humanizes you and earns goodwill before the pitch gets serious.

punchline.text: Laugh with the audience, never at them.

quiz.question: What type of humor works best in sales pitches?
